title: Virtual Reality-Based Mathematics Instructional Design: Systems Thinking Approach (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of secondary-level math fundamentals and digital device utilization skills
context.additional_context: Establishing VR-based mathematics education environments for adult learners and applying systems-thinking pedagogy.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain three-dimensional geometry concepts in VR environments.

Using a systems thinking approach (analyzing system components, mapping interactions, identifying feedback loops), learners can design step-by-step problem-solving strategies for ≥3 given math problems and write reports meeting ≥2 of the teacher’s evaluation criteria (clarity, logic, creativity).

Learners can select ≥3 VR-based math education tools (e.g., GeoGebra VR, Mathspace VR), evaluate each on a 1–5 scale according to a provided rubric (≥5 items: educational value, interactivity, accessibility), and write a 1-page comparative analysis report.

Using GeoGebra or Desmos, learners can plan ≥2 educational scenarios applying middle school-level equations, functions, and geometry concepts and submit deliverables (plan + execution examples) meeting ≥4 of 5 peer/teacher feedback criteria (creativity, feasibility, educational impact, technology utilization, student engagement) within the 6-month course.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
